name: Shilo Inn Grants Pass

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Shilo Inn, Grants Pass OR, at the same time as booking the Shilo Inn at Tillamook OR. We have made comment about our stay in Tillamook seperately. We paid approx $90 for Grants Pass, which was adequate for our overnight stay. The swimming pool was closed for maintainence whilst we were there, but we were told we could use the YMCA pool for no charge. We didn't bother. We asked for a recommendation for a good restaurant in Town, and were directed to 'The Brewery' which was excellent. The room was OK, nothing special, but clean and the beds comfortable. We didn't try the free continental breakfast. The Shilo Inn was good enough for our overnight stay in Grants Pass. No complaints.
reviews.title: Good Enough !!

likes.disliked: — Adequate for our purpose. No complaints.

reviews.title: Rainy Night
reviews.text: Stayed at Shiloh Inn in Grant's Pass on June 12 while driving south. The check-in and check-out folks were very courteous and friendly. However, on the afternoon that I checked in, there was a terrible downpour. Later that evening, as I stepped to the window to close the drapes, I noticed that the carpet was sopping wet on the window wall plus the two adjacent walls about 8" out and radiating to a lesser dampness to about 12" - 13". I could not detect where the water was coming. It was obvious that it was not from the window as the casing was dry so I concluded the water had came in at the foundation level or down into the walls. Because it was very late, I decided to report this in the morning.

reviews.title: Barebones but adequate
reviews.text: I did have to think hard and fast about plugging in my camera and phone chargers on those walls! I finally chanced it but it could have been dangerous. I did report the leakage when I checked out. I only hope they took up the carpet (newly renovated) to dry it out and fix where the water was coming in.

reviews.title: I love Shilo
reviews.text: M. Topacio

reviews.title: Wasn't bad....
reviews.text: This is your basic roadside motel in the kind of town most people are just stopping in for the night because they don't want to drive any more that night on their road trip. It's a bit run-down, but serves its purpose. The rooms are spacious, there's plenty of parking, but overall the place is a bit rickety. But the air conditioning was blasting, and that's a big plus on a hot summer day in southern Oregon when the temperatures are over 100F. The biggest plus of the room was free wireless Internet access. There's a complimentary continental breakfast available in the lobby for you to take back to your room, with basics such as cereal, bagels, pastries and coffee. There's not much in the neighbourhood but fast food joints.

reviews.title: best sleep ever
reviews.text: I am from Seattle,WA, and I came to Grants Pass, Or to see and old friend on August 7th. I was traveling with my dog as well. I was trying to find a hotel that allowed my dog. I called Shilo and they allowed pets, so I desided to stay there. It was the best hotel I stayed in. The people were so nice and the room was very clean and comfortable. Both my dog and I selpt the entire night, my dog like the fact that they had treats. I recommended this hotel to everyone I know. Thank you for a great stay.

reviews.title: We really enjoyed the hospitality
reviews.text: After reading reviews from some previous guests...I was a bit skeptical about staying at the Shilo Inn. My Family and I were pleasantly surprised to find that the Grants Pass Shilo Inn was both Affordable and Excellent. Our Check-In was fast and easy. The Desk person was very pleasant and helpful. Upon entering the room we found it extremely clean. The new carpet and tile are a wonderful touch...we can't wait to see what the rest of the improvements will be. The Continental breakfast made it easier to get "On the Road". And so much to choose from. Thank You for All Your Hospitality Grants Pass!!! We will be returning...

reviews.title: Had a nice, quiet and comfortable stay!
reviews.text: Shilo Inn is our choice in Grants Pass to stay. We are never disappointed and we are very interested to see the change when the remodel is complete.

reviews.title: Cannot wait to see how beautiful the 'Remodel' turns out!
reviews.text: Brand new "clear" windows in the hallways show new views of the mountains which is nice. The carpet and tile work is looking great. We are letting our friends know! Thanks Shilo!

To the future and returning Shilo Inn traveling guests, We were truly saddened to see the unfair reviews that have been given Shilo Inn Grants Pass. We also traveled through in mid August. We did not experience anything so negative to result in a bad review. Actually we enjoyed the crystal clean pool, big spacious "clean" room, even the housekeeper said to us "Have a great day"! We can only wish you a speedy remodel and cannot wait to see your Hotel again soon. It will be beautiful.
reviews.title: If you like the smell of roach spray and old dingy wrinkled sheets...
Gave us a "break" for late check out
reviews.text: We attended a wedding in Grants Pass, Oregon, and stayed at the Shilo Inn. We arrived on Friday night for the rehearsal. The wedding was Saturday night, therefore, we needed a late check-out on Saturday, so that our family could get dressed for the wedding.

reviews.title: Horrible Night at Shiloh Inn!
reviews.text: The front-desk clerk very kindly gave us a break by charging us only $30, instead of the quoted price of $60 for late check-out.

reviews.title: A good place to stay
reviews.text: We were very grateful for this act of kindness since the whole wedding ordeal cost us considerably with gas, food, and motel.

reviews.title: We Loved are Visit there
reviews.text: Also the rooms are being completely redecorated. Nice accommodations with large spacious rooms.

reviews.title: Good value
reviews.text: Stayed here May 17, 2005 on the way to California. The sheets were very thin and worn. The pillows were the most uncomfortable I've ever had to use. The carpet was just plain nasty, being an old teal color with many large stains and burn holes. The bathroom seemed clean, but the sink was all chipped. This room needed a complete remodel. The free continental breakfast the next morning had oranges for the fruit and was very limited and unappetizing. Wouldn't ever return, as the whole night was horrible and I was tired the next day from a bad nights' sleep.
A little disappointed after forking out a few dollars short of 100 for one night's stay.
reviews.title: Not bad motel

reviews.text: Newly remodeled according to the front desk two years ago. Clean but a bit dingy. Beds not wonderful but not terrible.
reviews.title: An excellent choice in Grants Pass
Good stay but nothing fancy
reviews.text: Parking around the interior courtyard.

reviews.title: Very nice stay!
reviews.text: Breakfast consisted of cereal, bread selection coffee and juice in a tiny area by the check in desk. I think they expect guests to take food back across car park to room as they have only two couches to eat...luckily we were the only ones there to eat.
Stay again? I'd try somewhere else but could do it again. It was average.
